Description: Lip and wall sherd of East Greek (North Ionian) pottery lotus or rosette bowl; interior glazed with traces of painted bands below lip; exterior: top of rim glazed; reserved below with one broad glaze band; inscription cut on lower wall on exterior.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Apollo (Naukratis), temenos (said to be)
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.358)
